project.name: The meteor-roles API
project.description: The meteor-roles API: an authorization package for Meteor

UIHelpers.name: UIHelpers
UIHelpers.description:
Convenience functions for use on client.

NOTE: You must restrict user actions on the server-side; any
client-side checks are strictly for convenience and must not be
trusted.

Roles.name: Roles
Roles.description:
Provides functions related to user authorization. Compatible with built-in Meteor accounts packages.

Roles are accessible throgh `Meteor.roles` collection and documents consist of:
 - `_id`: role name
 - `children`: list of subdocuments:
   - `_id`

Children list elements are subdocuments so that they can be easier extended in the future or by plugins.

Roles can have multiple parents and can be children (subroles) of multiple roles.

Example: `{_id: 'admin', children: [{_id: 'editor'}]}`

The assignment of a role to a user is stored in a collection, accessible through `Meteor.roleAssignment`.
It's documents consist of
 - `_id`: Internal MongoDB id
 - `role`: A role object which got assigned. Usually only contains the `_id` property
 - `user`: A user object, usually only contains the `_id` property
 - `scope`: scope name
 - `inheritedRoles`: A list of all the roles objects inherited by the assigned role.

classitems.description: Subscription handle for the collection of all existing roles.
example: Roles.subscription.ready(); // true if roles have been loaded
classitems.name: subscription

classitems.description:
UI helper to check if current user is in at least one
of the target roles.  For use in client-side templates.
classitems.name: isInRole

params.name: role
params.description: Name of role or comma-seperated list of roles.

params.name: scope
params.description: Optional, name of scope to check.

return.description: `true` if current user is in at least one of the target roles.

classitems.description: Used as a global group (now scope) name. Not used anymore.
classitems.name: GLOBAL_GROUP

classitems.description: Create a new role.
classitems.name: createRole

params.name: roleName
params.description: Name of role.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `unlessExists`: if `true`, exception will not be thrown in the role already exists

return.description: ID of the new role or null.

classitems.description:
Delete an existing role.

If the role is set for any user, it is automatically unset.
classitems.name: deleteRole

params.name: roleName
params.description: Name of role.

classitems.description: Rename an existing role.
classitems.name: renameRole

params.name: oldName
params.description: Old name of a role.

params.name: newName
params.description: New name of a role.

classitems.description:
Add role parent to roles.

Previous parents are kept (role can have multiple parents). For users which have the
parent role set, new subroles are added automatically.
classitems.name: addRolesToParent

params.name: rolesNames
params.description: Name(s) of role(s).

params.name: parentName
params.description: Name of parent role.

params.name: roleName
params.description: Name of role.

params.name: parentName
params.description: Name of parent role.

classitems.description:
Remove role parent from roles.

Other parents are kept (role can have multiple parents). For users which have the
parent role set, removed subrole is removed automatically.
classitems.name: removeRolesFromParent

params.name: rolesNames
params.description: Name(s) of role(s).

params.name: parentName
params.description: Name of parent role.

params.name: roleName
params.description: Name of role.

params.name: parentName
params.description: Name of parent role.

classitems.description:
Add users to roles.

Adds roles to existing roles for each user.
example:
Roles.addUsersToRoles(userId, 'admin')
    Roles.addUsersToRoles(userId, ['view-secrets'], 'example.com')
    Roles.addUsersToRoles([user1, user2], ['user','editor'])
    Roles.addUsersToRoles([user1, user2], ['glorious-admin', 'perform-action'], 'example.org')
classitems.name: addUsersToRoles

params.name: users
params.description: User ID(s) or object(s) with an `_id` field.

params.name: roles
params.description: Name(s) of roles to add users to. Roles have to exist.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of the scope, or `null` for the global role
  - `ifExists`: if `true`, do not throw an exception if the role does not exist

Alternatively, it can be a scope name string.

classitems.description:
Set users' roles.

Replaces all existing roles with a new set of roles.
example:
Roles.setUserRoles(userId, 'admin')
    Roles.setUserRoles(userId, ['view-secrets'], 'example.com')
    Roles.setUserRoles([user1, user2], ['user','editor'])
    Roles.setUserRoles([user1, user2], ['glorious-admin', 'perform-action'], 'example.org')
classitems.name: setUserRoles

params.name: users
params.description: User ID(s) or object(s) with an `_id` field.

params.name: roles
params.description: Name(s) of roles to add users to. Roles have to exist.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of the scope, or `null` for the global role
  - `anyScope`: if `true`, remove all roles the user has, of any scope, if `false`, only the one in the same scope
  - `ifExists`: if `true`, do not throw an exception if the role does not exist

Alternatively, it can be a scope name string.

classitems.description: Add one user to one role.
classitems.name: _addUserToRole

params.name: userId
params.description: The user ID.

params.name: roleName
params.description: Name of the role to add the user to. The role have to exist.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of the scope, or `null` for the global role
  - `ifExists`: if `true`, do not throw an exception if the role does not exist

classitems.description: Returns an array of role names the given role name is a child of.
classitems.name: _getParentRoleNames

params.name: role
params.description: The role object

classitems.description: Returns an array of role names the given role name is a parent of.
classitems.name: _getInheritedRoleNames

params.name: role
params.description: The role object

classitems.description: Remove users from assigned roles.
classitems.name: removeUsersFromRoles

params.name: users
params.description: User ID(s) or object(s) with an `_id` field.

params.name: roles
params.description: Name(s) of roles to remove users from. Roles have to exist.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of the scope, or `null` for the global role
  - `anyScope`: if set, role can be in any scope (`scope` option is ignored)

Alternatively, it can be a scope name string.

classitems.description: Remove one user from one role.
classitems.name: _removeUserFromRole

params.name: userId
params.description: The user ID.

params.name: roleName
params.description: Name of the role to add the user to. The role have to exist.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of the scope, or `null` for the global role
  - `anyScope`: if set, role can be in any scope (`scope` option is ignored)

classitems.description: Check if user has specified roles.
example:
// global roles
    Roles.userIsInRole(user, 'admin')
    Roles.userIsInRole(user, ['admin','editor'])
    Roles.userIsInRole(userId, 'admin')
    Roles.userIsInRole(userId, ['admin','editor'])

    // scope roles (global roles are still checked)
    Roles.userIsInRole(user, 'admin', 'group1')
    Roles.userIsInRole(userId, ['admin','editor'], 'group1')
    Roles.userIsInRole(userId, ['admin','editor'], {scope: 'group1'})
classitems.name: userIsInRole

params.name: user
params.description: User ID or an actual user object.

params.name: roles
params.description:
Name of role or an array of roles to check against. If array,
                            will return `true` if user is in _any_ role.
                            Roles do not have to exist.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of the scope; if supplied, limits check to just that scope
    the user's global roles will always be checked whether scope is specified or not
  - `anyScope`: if set, role can be in any scope (`scope` option is ignored)

Alternatively, it can be a scope name string.

return.description: `true` if user is in _any_ of the target roles

classitems.description: Retrieve user's roles.
classitems.name: getRolesForUser

params.name: user
params.description: User ID or an actual user object.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of scope to provide roles for; if not specified, global roles are returned
  - `anyScope`: if set, role can be in any scope (`scope` and `onlyAssigned` options are ignored)
  - `onlyScoped`: if set, only roles in the specified scope are returned
  - `onlyAssigned`: return only assigned roles and not automatically inferred (like subroles)
  - `fullObjects`: return full roles objects (`true`) or just names (`false`) (`onlyAssigned` option is ignored) (default `false`)
    If you have a use-case for this option, please file a feature-request. You shouldn't need to use it as it's
    result strongly dependant on the internal data structure of this plugin.

Alternatively, it can be a scope name string.

classitems.description: Retrieve cursor of all existing roles.
classitems.name: getAllRoles

params.name: queryOptions
params.description:
Options which are passed directly
                               through to `Meteor.roles.find(query, options)`.

classitems.description:
Retrieve all users who are in target role.

Options:
classitems.name: getUsersInRole

params.name: roles
params.description:
Name of role or an array of roles. If array, users
                            returned will have at least one of the roles
                            specified but need not have _all_ roles.
                            Roles do not have to exist.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of the scope to restrict roles to; user's global
    roles will also be checked
  - `anyScope`: if set, role can be in any scope (`scope` option is ignored)
  - `onlyScoped`: if set, only roles in the specified scope are returned
  - `queryOptions`: options which are passed directly
    through to `Meteor.users.find(query, options)`

Alternatively, it can be a scope name string.

params.name: queryOptions
params.description:
Options which are passed directly
                               through to `Meteor.users.find(query, options)`

classitems.description:
Retrieve all assignments of a user which are for the target role.

Options:
classitems.name: getUserAssignmentsForRole

params.name: roles
params.description:
Name of role or an array of roles. If array, users
                            returned will have at least one of the roles
                            specified but need not have _all_ roles.
                            Roles do not have to exist.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of the scope to restrict roles to; user's global
    roles will also be checked
  - `anyScope`: if set, role can be in any scope (`scope` option is ignored)
  - `queryOptions`: options which are passed directly
    through to `Meteor.roleAssignment.find(query, options)`

Alternatively, it can be a scope name string.

return.description: Cursor of user assignments for roles.

params.name: roles
params.description:
Name of role or an array of roles. If array, ids of users are
                            returned which have at least one of the roles
                            assigned but need not have _all_ roles.
                            Roles do not have to exist.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options:
  - `scope`: name of the scope to restrict roles to; user's global
    roles will also be checked
  - `anyScope`: if set, role can be in any scope (`scope` option is ignored)

Alternatively, it can be a scope name string.

params.name: filter
params.description:
Options which are passed directly
                               through to `Meteor.roleAssignment.find(query, options)`

Find out if a role is an ancestor of another role.

WARNING: If you check this on the client, please make sure all roles are published.

Returns `true` if the `roles` field is in the old format.

classitems.description: Migrates `Meteor.users` and `Meteor.roles` to the new format.
classitems.name: _forwardMigrate

params.name: updateUser
params.description: Function which updates the user object. Default `_defaultUpdateUser`.

params.name: updateRole
params.description: Function which updates the role object. Default `_defaultUpdateRole`.

params.name: convertUnderscoresToDots
params.description: Should we convert underscores to dots in group names.

classitems.description: Moves the assignments from `Meteor.users` to `Meteor.roleAssignment`.
classitems.name: _forwardMigrate2

params.name: userSelector
params.description: An opportunity to share the work among instances. It's advisable to do the division based on user-id.

classitems.description:
Migrates `Meteor.users` and `Meteor.roles` to the old format.

We assume that we are converting back a failed migration, so values can only be
what were valid values in the old format. So no group names starting with `$` and
no subroles.
classitems.name: _backwardMigrate

params.name: updateUser
params.description: Function which updates the user object. Default `_defaultUpdateUser`.

params.name: updateRole
params.description: Function which updates the role object. Default `_defaultUpdateRole`.

params.name: usingGroups
params.description: Should we use groups or not.

classitems.description: Moves the assignments from `Meteor.roleAssignment` back to to `Meteor.users`.
classitems.name: _backwardMigrate2

params.name: assignmentSelector
params.description: An opportunity to share the work among instances. It's advisable to do the division based on user-id.
